thread.title: Restraining order issued against anti-abortion group's video | Fox News
thread.title_full: Restraining order issued against anti-abortion group's video | Fox News

title: Restraining order issued against anti-abortion group's video | Fox News
text:
Restraining order issued against anti-abortion group's video Published July 29, 2015 Facebook 0 Twitter 0 livefyre Email Print 
LOS ANGELES â€“ A temporary restraining order has been issued preventing an anti-abortion group from releasing any video of leaders of a California company that provides fetal tissue to researchers. The group is the same one that previously shot viral covert video of a Planned Parenthood leader discussing the sale of aborted fetuses for research. 
The Los Angeles Superior Court order issued Tuesday prohibits the Center for Medical Progress from releasing any video of three StemExpress officials taken at a restaurant in May. 
StemExpress is a Placerville, California-based company that provides human tissue, blood and other specimens to researchers. Planned Parenthood is one of the company's providers of fetal tissue. 
The Center for Medical Progress has released three covertly recorded videos. Anti-abortion groups have called on lawmakers to take action. 
Center leader David Daleiden said StemExpress was using "meritless litigation" to cover up an "illegal baby parts trade." Advertisement
